bullets.text: U.S. productivity surged 4.9% in Q3 2025 while unit labor costs fell 1.9%, easing inflation pressure and supporting margins.
October 2025 U.S. international trade data updates the goods-and-services deficit, a key driver of GDP tracking and dollar demand.
China inflation hit the fastest pace in nearly three years, complicating stimulus plans as demand remains uneven and producer prices stay under pressure.
Friday’s U.S. jobs report is a near-term market catalyst for rate expectations, testing the rally amid shifting sector leadership.
Trump-backed idea to buy $200B of mortgage bonds signals potential policy pressure on housing finance; impact depends on execution and Fed/agency roles.
Defense stocks rallied on talk of a $1.5T military budget, but investors face uncertainty on Congressional approval and deficit implications.
GM will take $7.1B in Q4 charges tied to EV pullback and China restructuring, underscoring slower-than-expected EV transition economics.
Senate vote to block future U.S. strikes on Venezuela highlights war-powers constraints amid heightened tanker interdiction and oil geopolitics.
Iran’s internet shutdown during escalating protests signals regime stress and raises regional-security and energy-market tail risks.
Ukraine awarding a major lithium project to investors linked to Trump spotlights strategic-minerals politics and potential conflicts-of-interest risks in reconstruction.
U.S. interest in Greenland critical minerals underscores supply-chain decoupling and competition with China over rare earths and battery materials.
Researchers explore “antacids for the sea” to counter ocean acidification, highlighting growing interest—and governance challenges—in carbon-removal and geoengineering approaches.
NASA plans to return I.S.S. astronauts weeks early due to a medical issue, underscoring operational risk management in long-duration spaceflight.
